intro: Metastelma hernandifolium, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico, characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
